alert.note: Alert for Blanco; Gillespie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 11:10PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Blanco and east central Gillespie Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1110 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sandy, or 13 miles southwest of Round Mountain, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Round Mountain, Johnson City, Stonewall, Rocky Creek, Hye, Cypress Mill, Blowout, Sandy, Pedernales Falls State Park, LBJ State Park and LBJ National Historical Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central Texas.
